page.title: 12Rangemore Estate Cultivation
page.content:
The Rangemore Estate farmland is cultivated in the following ways: Winter Wheat (Avalon) {244.5 acres (60.2 milling,184.3 seed) Winter Barley (Igri) {118.4 acres (all for feed) Forage Maize (Leader/ (cattle feed) Bastille) {48.7 acres Spring Barley (Atem/Apex) {84.3 acres (cattle feed) 1st Year Ley {111.8 acres 2nd Year Ley {160.6 acres 3rd Year Ley {107.2 acres Permanent Pasture {309.3 acres
Grass is the main crop for grazing, hay and silage. 7100 bales of hay, 18000 bales of straw, 3000 tons of grass silage and 1000 tons of maize silage are made each year. There are {300 acres}of woodland.{158 acres}were planted in the last 20 years.
